message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this unique product. I think you'll really love it! I'm willing to sell it to you for $12,000. What do you think?
Alice, thanks for the offer, but $12,000 is a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $9,000 for the product.  Let me know what you think.
Bob, I understand you're looking for a better deal, but I have to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $11,000. What do you think?
Alice, I appreciate you coming down a bit, but I'm still only comfortable at $9,500.  I really want this product, and this is the highest I can go right now.

Bob, I understand you're really interested in the product, and I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway. I'm willing to compromise further and sell it to you for $10,500. This is as low as I can go.
Alice, I really want this product, but I can't go any higher than $10,000.  This is my final offer.

Bob, I've made a few concessions already, but I still need to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you at $10,000, but I need you to throw in something extra. I want you to agree to a 5% service fee on top of the purchase price. This way, I'll still come out ahead. What do you think?
